frame.name: Awareness
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a piece of <fen>Content</fen> in their model of the world. The <fen>Content</fen> is not necessarily present due to immediate perception, but usually, rather, due to deduction from perceivables. In some cases, the deduction of the <fen>Content</fen> is implicitly based on confidence in sources of information (<ment>believe</ment>), in some cases based on logic (<ment>think</ment>), and in other cases the source of the deduction is deprofiled (<ment>know</ment>).
Note that this frame is undergoing some degree of reconsideration. Many of the targets will be moved to the Opinion frame. That frame indicates that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> considers something as true, but the Opinion (compare to <fen>Content</fen>) is not presupposed to be true; rather it is something that is considered a potential point of difference. In the uses that will remain in the Awareness frame, however, the <fen>Content</fen> is presupposed.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">Your boss</fex> is <t>aware</t> <fex name="Content">of your commitment</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose awareness of phenomena is at question. With a target verb or adjective the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is generally expressed as an External Argument with the <fen>Content</fen> expressed as an Object or Complement. <ex><fex name="Cognizer">Your boss</fex> is <t>aware</t> of your commitment.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cognizer">The students</fex> do not <t>know</t> the answer.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cognizer">Pat</fex> <t>believes</t> that things will change for the better.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s awareness. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a direct object or in a PP Complement.
<ex>Your boss is <t>aware</t> <fex name="Content">of your commitment</fex>.</ex> <ex>The students do not <t>know</t> <fex name="Content">of your commitment</fex>.</ex> <ex>Pat <t>believes</t> <fex name="Content">that things will change for the better</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition: <def-root>The source of awareness or knowledge which can be expressed in a PP Complement: <ex>The sailors <t>knew</t> <fex name="Evid">from the look of the sky</fex> that a storm was coming.</ex> <ex>I <t>knew</t> <fex name="Evid">from experience</fex> that Jo would be late.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>Some verbs in this frame allow a <fen>Topic</fen> to be expressed in about-PPs. <ex>Kim <t>knows</t> <fex name="Topic">about first aid</fex>.</ex> However, a number of nouns and adjectives in this frame which cannot take about-phrases allow <fen>Topic</fen> to be expressed as an adjectival or adverbial modifier. <ex>Kim is <fex name="Topic">politically</fex> <t>aware</t>. </ex> <ex> <fex name="Topic">Environmental</fex> <t>consciousness</t> is increasing.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> knows or thinks something.</def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part that reveals the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s state to the observer. <ex>Bob's <fex name="Expr">eyes</fex> were overly <t>aware</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Role</fen> is the category within which an element of the <fen>Content</fen> is considered. <ex>He <t>understood</t> her remark <fex name="Role">as an insult</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Paradigm
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element identifies the <fen>Paradigm</fen> which serves as the basis for the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s awareness. <ex><fex name="Content">The formation of black holes</fex> should be <t>understood</t> <fex name="Paradigm">in astrophysic terms</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is aware of the <fen>Content</fen>.
<ex>Yet there is no evidence that Mr. Parrish was <t>cognizant</t> <fex name="tim">at the time of the signing of the notes</fex> that the clauses in issue were present.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason why or how it came to be that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has awareness of the <fen>Topic</fen> or <fen>Content</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: aware.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having knowledge or perception of a situation or fact.

lexUnit.name: awareness.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: awareness is a derivative of aware

lexUnit.name: believe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel sure of the truth of.

lexUnit.name: comprehend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: grasp mentally; understand.

lexUnit.name: comprehension.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or capability of understanding.

lexUnit.name: conceive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: devise in the mind; imagine.

lexUnit.name: conception.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the way in which something is perceived

lexUnit.name: conscious.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having awareness or knowledge of something

lexUnit.name: hunch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a feeling or guess based on intuition.

lexUnit.name: imagine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form a mental image or concept of.

lexUnit.name: know.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be aware of through observation, inquiry, or information. This verb is factive - speaker believes the proposition whether or not he is the subject.

lexUnit.name: knowledge.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: familiarity with, awareness of facts and ideas acquired through experience or study

lexUnit.name: knowledgeable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: intelligent and well informed.

lexUnit.name: presume.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: assume that something is the case absent proof to the contrary

lexUnit.name: presumption.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act or instance of presuming something to be the case.

lexUnit.name: reckon.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be of the opinion.

lexUnit.name: supposition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an assumption or hypothesis.

lexUnit.name: suspect.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: believe (something) to be probable or possible.

lexUnit.name: suspicion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a feeling that something is possible or probable or that someone is guilty of a crime or offence.

lexUnit.name: think.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: have a particular belief or opinion

lexUnit.name: thought.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process or result of thinking

lexUnit.name: understand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perceive the significance, explanation, or cause of.

lexUnit.name: understanding.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the ability to understand something; comprehension

lexUnit.name: ignorance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the stae of lacking knowledge or awareness in general.

lexUnit.name: consciousness.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: one's awareness or perception of something.

lexUnit.name: cognizant.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: fully aware

lexUnit.name: unknown.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not known or familiar.
